ai-sn52:1.1.2_0: At one time Venerable Anuruddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-sn52:1.1.3_0: Then as Anuruddha was in private retreat this thought came to his mind:
ai-sn52:1.1.4_0: “Whoever has missed out on these four kinds of mindfulness meditation has missed out on the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.
ai-sn52:1.1.5_0: Whoever has undertaken these four kinds of mindfulness meditation has undertaken the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.”
ai-sn52:1.2.1_0: Then Venerable Mahāmoggallāna knew what Venerable Anuruddha was thinking.
ai-sn52:1.2.1_1: so too, Anuruddha appeared in front of Anuruddha:
ai-sn52:1.2.3_0: “Reverend Anuruddha, how do you define the undertaking of the four kinds of mindfulness meditation by a mendicant?”
ai-sn52:1.3.1_0: “Reverend, it’s when a mendicant meditates observing the body internally as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to originate and vanish—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:1.3.2_0: They meditate observing the body externally as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to originate and vanish—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:1.3.3_0: They meditate observing the body internally and externally as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to originate and vanish—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:1.4.1_0: If they wish: ‘May I meditate perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-sn52:1.4.2_0: If they wish: ‘May I meditate perceiving the unrepulsive in the repulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-sn52:1.4.3_1: ‘May I meditate perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive and the repulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-sn52:1.4.4_1: ‘May I meditate perceiving the unrepulsive in the repulsive and the unrepulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-sn52:1.4.5_1: ‘May I meditate staying equanimous, mindful and aware, rejecting both the repulsive and the unrepulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-sn52:1.5.3_0: internally and externally as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to originate and vanish ...
ai-sn52:1.6.1_0: If they wish: ‘May I meditate perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-sn52:1.6.2_0: If they wish: ‘May I meditate perceiving the unrepulsive in the repulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-sn52:1.6.3_1: ‘May I meditate perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive and the repulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-sn52:1.6.4_1: ‘May I meditate perceiving the unrepulsive in the repulsive and the unrepulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-sn52:1.6.5_1: ‘May I meditate staying equanimous, mindful and aware, rejecting both the repulsive and the unrepulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-sn52:1.7.1_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind internally ...
ai-sn52:1.7.3_0: internally and externally as liable to originate,
ai-sn52:1.8.1_0: If they wish: ‘May I meditate perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive,’ that’s what they do. ...
ai-sn52:1.8.2_0: he dwells equanimous, mindful and aware.
ai-sn52:1.9.3_0: internally and externally as liable to originate,
ai-sn52:1.9.3_2: internally and externally as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to originate and vanish—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:1.10.1_0: If they wish: ‘May I meditate perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive,’ that’s what they do. ...
ai-sn52:1.10.2_0: he dwells equanimous, mindful and aware.
ai-sn52:1.10.3_0: That’s how to define the undertaking of the four kinds of mindfulness meditation by a mendicant.”
ai-sn52:2.1.2_0: Then as Anuruddha was in private retreat this thought came to his mind:
ai-sn52:2.1.3_0: “Whoever has missed out on these four kinds of mindfulness meditation has missed out on the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.
ai-sn52:2.1.4_0: Whoever has undertaken these four kinds of mindfulness meditation has undertaken the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.”
ai-sn52:2.2.1_0: Then Venerable Mahāmoggallāna knew what Venerable Anuruddha was thinking.
ai-sn52:2.2.1_1: so too, Anuruddha appeared in front of Anuruddha:
ai-sn52:2.3.1_0: “Reverend Anuruddha, how do you define the undertaking of the four kinds of mindfulness meditation by a mendicant?”
ai-sn52:2.4.1_0: “Reverend, it’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body internally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:2.4.2_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the body externally ...
ai-sn52:2.4.3_0: internally and externally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:2.5.1_0: They meditate observing an aspect of feelings internally ...
ai-sn52:2.5.3_0: internally and externally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:2.6.1_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind internally ...
ai-sn52:2.7.3_0: internally and externally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:2.7.4_0: That’s how to define the undertaking of the four kinds of mindfulness meditation by a mendicant.”
ai-sn52:3.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Anuruddha was staying near Sāvatthī on the bank of the Sutanu.
ai-sn52:3.1.2_0: Then many monks went to venerable Anuruddha,
ai-sn52:3.1.2_1: and after going, they exchanged greetings with him.
ai-sn52:3.1.3_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side.
ai-sn52:3.1.4_0: “What things has Venerable Anuruddha developed and cultivated to attain great direct knowledge?”
ai-sn52:3.2.1_0: “Reverends, I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-sn52:3.2.3_0: I meditate observing an aspect of the body ...
ai-sn52:3.2.5_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind ...
ai-sn52:3.2.6_0: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:3.2.7_0: I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-sn52:3.2.8_0: And it was by developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I directly knew the lower realm as lower, the middle realm as middle, and the higher realm as higher.”
ai-sn52:4.1.1_0: At one time the venerables Anuruddha, Sāriputta, and Mahāmoggallāna were staying near Sāketa, in the Thorny Wood.
ai-sn52:4.1.2_0: Then in the late afternoon, Sāriputta and Mahāmoggallāna came out of retreat, went to Anuruddha,
ai-sn52:4.1.2_1: and after going, they exchanged greetings with him.
ai-sn52:4.1.3_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side.
ai-sn52:4.1.4_0: “Reverend Anuruddha, what things should a trainee mendicant enter and remain in?”
ai-sn52:4.2.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, a trainee mendicant should enter and remain in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-sn52:4.2.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?
ai-sn52:4.2.3_0: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:4.2.5_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind ...
ai-sn52:4.2.6_0: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:4.2.7_0: A trainee mendicant should enter and remain in these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”
ai-sn52:5.1.3_0: “Reverend Anuruddha, what things should a trainee mendicant enter and remain in?”
ai-sn52:5.1.4_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, a trainee mendicant should enter and remain in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-sn52:5.1.5_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?
ai-sn52:5.1.6_0: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:5.1.8_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind ...
ai-sn52:5.1.9_0: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:5.1.10_0: A mendicant who is an adept should enter and remain in these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”
ai-sn52:6.1.3_0: “What things has Venerable Anuruddha developed and cultivated to attain great direct knowledge?”
ai-sn52:6.1.4_0: “Reverends, I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-sn52:6.1.6_0: I meditate observing an aspect of the body ...
ai-sn52:6.1.8_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind ...
ai-sn52:6.1.9_0: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:6.1.10_0: I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-sn52:6.1.11_0: And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I directly know the entire galaxy.”
ai-sn52:6.1.12_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-sn52:7.1.2_0: There Venerable Anuruddha addressed the mendicants:
ai-sn52:7.2.1_0: “Reverends, when these four kinds of mindfulness meditation are developed and cultivated they lead to the ending of craving.
ai-sn52:7.2.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?
ai-sn52:7.2.3_0: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body ...
ai-sn52:7.2.5_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind ...
ai-sn52:7.2.6_0: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:7.2.7_0: When these four kinds of mindfulness meditation are developed and cultivated they lead to the ending of craving.”
ai-sn52:8.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Anuruddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the frankincense-tree hut.
ai-sn52:8.1.2_0: There Venerable Anuruddha addressed the mendicants:
ai-sn52:8.1.3_0: “Reverends, the Ganges river slants, slopes, and inclines to the east.
ai-sn52:8.1.4_0: a large crowd were to come along with a spade and basket, saying:
ai-sn52:8.1.5_0: ‘We’ll make this Ganges river slant, slope, and incline to the west!’
ai-sn52:8.1.6_0: What do you think, reverends? Would they succeed?”
ai-sn52:8.1.9_0: The Ganges river slants, slopes, and inclines to the east.
ai-sn52:8.1.10_0: It’s not easy to make it slant, slope, and incline to the west.
ai-sn52:8.1.11_0: That large crowd will eventually get weary and frustrated.”
ai-sn52:8.2.1_0: “In the same way, while a mendicant develops and cultivates the four kinds of mindfulness meditation, if rulers or their ministers, friends or colleagues, relatives or family should invite them to accept wealth, saying:
ai-sn52:8.2.2_0: ‘Please, mister, why let these ocher robes torment you?
ai-sn52:8.2.3_0: Why follow the practice of shaving your head and carrying an alms bowl?
ai-sn52:8.2.4_0: Come, return to a lesser life, enjoy wealth, and make merit!’
ai-sn52:8.3.1_0: It’s simply impossible for a mendicant who is developing and cultivating the four kinds of mindfulness meditation to resign the training and return to a lesser life.
ai-sn52:8.3.3_0: Because for a long time that mendicant’s mind has slanted, sloped, and inclined to seclusion. So it’s impossible for them to return to a lesser life.
ai-sn52:8.3.4_0: And how does a mendicant develop the four kinds of mindfulness meditation?
ai-sn52:8.3.5_0: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body ...
ai-sn52:8.3.7_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind ...
ai-sn52:8.3.8_0: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:8.3.9_0: That’s how a mendicant develops and cultivates the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”
ai-sn52:9.1.1_0: At one time the venerables Anuruddha and Sāriputta were staying near Vesālī, in Ambapālī’s Wood.
ai-sn52:9.1.2_0: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Sāriputta came out of retreat ...
ai-sn52:9.2.1_0: “Reverend Anuruddha, your faculties are so very clear, and your complexion is pure and bright.
ai-sn52:9.2.2_0: What kind of meditation are you usually practicing these days?”
ai-sn52:9.2.3_0: “These days I usually meditate with my mind firmly established in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-sn52:9.2.5_0: I meditate observing an aspect of the body ...
ai-sn52:9.2.7_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind ...
ai-sn52:9.2.8_0: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:9.2.9_0: These days I usually meditate with my mind firmly established in these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-sn52:9.2.10_0: A mendicant who is perfected—with defilements ended, who has completed the spiritual journey, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved their own true goal, utterly ended the fetters of rebirth, and is rightly freed through enlightenment—usually meditates with their mind firmly established in these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”
ai-sn52:9.3.1_0: “It is a gain for us, friend, it is a great gain for us, friend,
ai-sn52:9.3.2_0: to have heard such a dramatic statement in the presence of Venerable Anuruddha.”
ai-sn52:10.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Anuruddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Dark Forest, and he was sick, suffering, gravely ill.
ai-sn52:10.1.2_0: Then many monks went to venerable Anuruddha,
ai-sn52:10.1.2_1: and after going, they said this to venerable Anuruddha:
ai-sn52:10.2.1_0: “What meditation does Venerable Anuruddha practice so that physical pain doesn’t occupy his mind?”
ai-sn52:10.2.2_0: “Reverends, I meditate with my mind firmly established in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation so that physical pain doesn’t occupy my mind.
ai-sn52:10.2.4_0: I meditate observing an aspect of the body ...
ai-sn52:10.2.6_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind ...
ai-sn52:10.2.7_0: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:10.2.8_0: I meditate with my mind firmly established in these four kinds of mindfulness meditation so that physical pain doesn’t occupy my mind.”
ai-sn52:10.2.10_0: The first sub-chapter on private, is finished.
ai-sn52:10.3.1_0: they’re spoken of two kinds of hide:
ai-sn52:11.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Anuruddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-sn52:11.1.2_0: Then many monks went to venerable Anuruddha,
ai-sn52:11.1.2_1: and after approaching he exchanged greetings with him ...
ai-sn52:11.2.1_0: “What things has Venerable Anuruddha developed and cultivated to attain great direct knowledge?”
ai-sn52:11.2.2_0: “Reverends, I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-sn52:11.2.4_0: I meditate observing an aspect of the body ...
ai-sn52:11.2.6_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind ...
ai-sn52:11.2.7_0: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn52:11.2.8_0: I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-sn52:11.2.9_0: And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I recollect a thousand eons.”
ai-sn52:12.1.1_0: “... And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I wield the many kinds of psychic power:
ai-sn52:13.1.1_0: “... And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that, with clairaudience that is purified and superhuman, I hear both kinds of sounds, human and divine, whether near or far.”
ai-sn52:14.1.1_0: “... And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I understand the minds of other beings and individuals, having comprehended them with my mind.
ai-sn52:14.1.2_0: I understand mind with greed as ‘mind with greed’ ...
ai-sn52:14.1.3_0: I understand unfreed mind as ‘unfreed mind’.”
ai-sn52:15.1.1_0: “... And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I truly understand the possible as possible and the impossible as impossible.”
ai-sn52:16.1.1_0: “... And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I truly understand the result of deeds undertaken in the past, future, and present in terms of causes and reasons.”
ai-sn52:16.1.2_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-sn52:17.1.1_0: “... And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I truly understand where all paths of practice lead.”
ai-sn52:18.1.1_0: “... And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I truly understand the world with its many and diverse elements.”
ai-sn52:19.1.1_0: “... And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I truly understand the diverse beliefs of sentient beings.”
ai-sn52:20.1.1_0: “... And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I truly understand the faculties of other sentient beings and other individuals after comprehending them with my mind.”
ai-sn52:21.1.1_0: “... And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I truly understand corruption, cleansing, and emergence regarding the absorptions, liberations, immersions, and attainments.”
ai-sn52:22.1.1_0: “... And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I recollect my many kinds of past lives, with features and details. ...
ai-sn52:22.1.1_1: I recollected my many kinds of past lives, with features and details.”
ai-sn52:23.1.1_0: “... And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, I see sentient beings passing away and being reborn ...
ai-sn52:23.1.1_1: They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.”
ai-sn52:24.1.1_0: “... And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And I live having realized it with my own insight due to the ending of defilements.”
ai-sn52:24.2.5_0: The Linked Discourses with Anuruddha are the eighth section.
